properties.headline: T3CON11 - Frankfurt
properties.text:
This year's biggest TYPO3 conference will again take place close to Frankfurt, Germany:

Thursday, October 6 - Saturday, October 8, 2011 in the Congress Park Hanau.

We invite you to a stunning event with a broad range of topics and professional speakers. This will be a great time to learn more about the powerful TYPO3 CMS, the FLOW3 framework and to connect with other managers, developers and designers from all over the world. Many internationally known leaders of the TYPO3 community will be attending and presenting.

Photostream T3CON10

More

properties.source:
Dates to watch

20May 2011
Call for Papers opens

Don't miss the opportunity to present at the T3CON11

01.06 2011
Early Bird tickets available
20.06 2011
Call for Papers closes
04.07 2011
Program Announced

properties.headline: Location
properties.text:
The T3CON11 Frankfurt will take place in the Congress Park Hanau, just a 30 minutes ride from Frankfurt International Airport. No road misses the Congress Park Hanau (CPH) â€“ it is central in every regard: at the center of Germany and at the heart of Hessen.

Hanau is situated just 34 kilometres from Frankfurt Airport and 20 kilometres from Messe Frankfurt, with an ICE high-speed train link and direct connections to the A3, A45 and A66 highways.

Birthplace of the Brothers Grimm, the town's location on the rivers Main and Kinzig makes it the economic and cultural centre of the eastern Rhine-Main region. Along with leading material technology companies, Hanau also has much to offer by way of culture and scenery, giving the CPH unique appeal throughout Germany.

properties.headline: Getting there by train
properties.text:
The Congress Park Hanau and Deutsche Bahn offer a specially priced package for getting to Hanau and back home. Detailed information on the special train ticket package is available in PDF form.

To get to the conference location from the train station you can take a cab or use public transport.

properties.headline: Getting there by plane
properties.text:
The Congress Park Hanau is located just 30 minutes from the airport in Frankfurt (FRA).

To get to the conference location from the airport you can take a cab or use public transport.

properties.headline: Getting there by public transport
properties.text:
The Congress Park Hanau can be reached with public transport easily.

Using buses number 2 or 10 go to stop "NordstraÃŸe", close to "Schlosspark" Taking bus number 3 leave at stop "Schlossplatz".

From the "Freiheitsplatz" (about 600 meters walking distance) connections into all of Hanau and to the central train station (lines number 2 and 7) are available until late in the night.

properties.headline: Getting there by car
properties.text: General: Follow the signs for "Congress Park Hanau" or "CPH". Detailed information on how to get there by car is available in PDF form.

properties.headline: Videos of past TYPO3 conferences
properties.text: As every year also last year our video team was hard at work and captured (most of) the sessions for your viewing pleasure. Below is a glimpse of what the T3CON channel over at vimeo has to offer.

properties.headline: Contribute to make TYPO3 even better!
properties.text:
TYPO3 is Open Source Software and therefore of course free to use and download. But having some money available for development, travel expenses, motivation and loads of other stuff helps TYPO3 a lot.

Company support

The TYPO3 Conference T3CON11 offers you as a company the opportunity to contribute to the TYPO3 project in many different ways. Sponsor the event with money to place your company logo in prominent positions or donate stuff or services your company offers. Find out more in the "Become a sponsor" section.

Individual support

Your support as an individual is also greatly appreciated. Why not help with all the small things during the conference as a "helping hand"? Or just donate 10 Euro to do your tiny bit for TYPO3?

properties.headline: Sponsoring T3CON11
properties.text:
There are many ways you can support the biggest conference of the TYPO3 community and at the same time get some real benefits for your company.

Advantages for your company

  • You position yourself within a unique surrounding without any divergence loss in a top-class target group of decision makers and visionaries
  • You profit of the exclusive image of an innovative conference
  • You can demonstrate the leading position of your corporation on the market and present your products in an optimized way
  • You can use T3CON11 as platform for networking in order to intensify your business relationships: Why not invite selected customers and partners?

There are various possibilities to get integrated in the event and to get in touch with your target group. Of course we will consider your individual ideas as well.

We are looking forward to welcome you as a partner or sponsor of the conference!

The Target Group

At T3CON11 the movers and shakers of the internet meet each other: entrepreneurs, managers, marketing decision makers, consultants, and investors. You will reach a unique collection of decision makers, executive managers, opinion leaders, early adopters, replicators, visionaries and trendsetters.

The participants of T3CON10 were

  • predominantly male
  • 20-49 years old
  • executive managers and decision makers

The intimate atmosphere offers enough space for information exchange, networking and the possibility to discuss topics which are a trend today and mass market tomorrow.

Become a Sponsor Now!

Options, prices and order form Contact now for sponsoring

properties.headline: Great response to T3CON10!
properties.text: T3CON10 was a real success! Have a look at the survey results about last years conference T3CON10 and expect T3CON11 to get even better!

properties.headline: Results of the T3CON10 visitor survey
properties.text:
What category do you fit in best?

It was interesting to see that there are lots of developers present at the conference. Since T3CON10 was targeted at business people, we see lots of potential here and will invite more business oriented people for 2011.

How do you rate the ticket fees for attending the conference?

We are happy to see that most people thought that tickets were fairly priced. So it is most likely that ticket prices will stay that way for T3CON11.

How do you rate the overall quality of the talks you attended?

Great, that people really liked the quality of the talks. We will of course try to get even better talks and more interesting speakers from TYPO3 related areas... But results like these make us happy.

What do you think about the hotel the conference took place in?

Most people liked the hotel and only a few had complaints which we already investigate. A general remark was, that having two different floors for the conference was a bit irritating. We'll see into it how we can improve that...

What is your opinion of the conference being in Frankfurt, Germany?

Not much to say but T3CON11 will again be in Frankfurt, Germany.

How likely is it that you attend the next TYPO3 conference T3CON11?

Nearly 50% of the conference visitors will definitely be back in 2010. That's great, especially since only very few are probably not coming.

What is your overall rating for T3CON10?

This is somehow one of the most rewarding facts about T3CON10: Seeing that nearly everybody liked the conference and it was a great success. This gives us fuel for all the thousands of hours of work necessary for T3CON10!

Thank you!

properties.headline: Indiviudal support
properties.text:
If you want to support the TYPO3 conference as an individual, just do it! Every single Euro of yours is appreciated! Just donate any amount you see fit for your personal situation using the TYPO3 donation form.

If you like to donate but things seem unclear for you, just get in contact!

properties.headline: domainFACTORY GmbH
properties.text:
In the year of its 10th anniversary Munich based domainFACTORY GmbH is one of the leading webhosting companies in Germany, serving more than 100,000 customers and managing well over 700,000 domain names. Following its claim "Premium Hosting. Premium Service." the company managed to establish itself as a high quality provider with an excellent price-performance ratio.

Due to the combination of high-end server systems, extensive feature sets and outstanding customer service domainFACTORY is capable of satisfying the high requirements of business customers and professionals. For agencies and resellers there is a product line available enabling companies to offer webhosting services in their own name.

With "JiffyBox" domainFACTORY recently launched an innovative cloud hosting service. The flexible on-demand virtual servers come with many interesting features and full remote control using the RESTful API. For cloud servers from JiffyBox you only pay what you use without any minimum contract commitments.

Offering a full range of webhosting services starting from domain registration to dedicated and cloud servers, domainFACTORY currently also hosts many TYPO3 based projects from small private up to big enterprise websites. The company's own website has also been running on TYPO3 for many years.

Facts

  • One of the leading webhosting companies in Germany
  • Over 100,000 customers with more than 700,000 domain names
  • High quality provider with excellent price-performance ratio
  • Webhosting services from domain registration to dedicated servers
  • Product line for agencies and resellers
  • Innovative cloud hosting service "JiffyBox"

Contact

Website: http://www.df.eu
E-mail: support@df.eu

Hotline: 0800 323 98 00 (outside Germany: +49 89 552660)

properties.headline: Post your question
properties.text: If you prefer forms over emails, just submit your question through the form below and we'll get back to you shortly.

properties.headline: Frequently Asked Questions
properties.text:
Why do I have to pay German VAT?

Even if you are from an EU country, the US or some other place in the world, you have to pay German Value Added Tax (VAT) for the conference fee. The reason is that the conference is held in Germany and all "proceedings" occur within the country. There is no way that someone could claim that a good is being shipped outside of Germany.

For example, when staying in a hotel in Germany, the bill is VAT-taxed as well. So, unfortunately, the VAT issue is out of our hands.

If you attend on behalf of a company then your tax official can tell you if and how to get the VAT back.

How do I pay using a bank transfer?

Bank transfers usually take about three working days to be processed. There are a couple of reasons why your transfer may not appear immediately in your online account.

First, you may have placed the order after the bank has processed their orders for the day (not all banks process even online banking immediately).

Second, we usually check our bank transfer records every day, but on some days this may not be possible.

On the day the bank transfer arrives in our bank account, we will process the payment and record the exact amount we received. If there is a gap between the amount paid and the amount due, the difference will be requested.

If you do not see your payment processed within 10 days, then something has gone wrong. Usually payments will be processed much faster, but please do not contact us earlier regarding bank transfers.

How do I book two half-day tutorials?

First register regularly for the conference and book one of the tutorials along with the registration. After finishing your registration you'll be logged-in automatically to your newly-created website account (login information will be sent to you by email, too). As a logged-in user you can return any time to the registration page ("Visitors"->"Registration & Order") and book an additional tutorial. Please take care not to "double book" - ordering two tutorials that run in parallel.

I only want to book tutorials, why does this not work?

We believe it is important for everyone to attend the main conference, so we do not offer an option to attend only the tutorials. The tutorials can only be booked if you are a regular attendee.

I booked one full day tutorial, why am I charged for two half day tutorials?

Each of the tutorials is only half a day long. So even when a topic continues for a full day, it will show on your invoice as two half-day tutorials.

properties.headline: Press
properties.text:
This press section is intended to help you with your work as an active journalist. You will be able to accredit online for T3CON11 at this website and we will try to assist you by all means possible.

What you get as an accredited journalist

  • Free entry to the conference
  • First hand press information about the conference
  • Priority contact for important questions regarding T3CON11 and TYPO3
  • Exclusive invitation and free entry to TYPO3 annual "press get together"

VAT ID

VAT ID per Â§27a UStG: DE267193843

Personal data protection

If you provide us with personal data (e.g. your name, address or email), that data will be used only for the indicated purpose. It will not be given to third parties.

A cookie is a little textfile, that is stored from your browser on your system. We use cookies to keep your session activated. We do not use cookies for personal data recognition, but only to collect anonymous statistical data. If you choose to disable cookies, you may still use this website, but some functionality will not be available.

For statistical reasons we collect the following technical data:

  • requested file
  • type of browser
  • type of operating system
  • referrer URL
  • time and date of the use of the website
  • your IP address
This data is collected anonymously and will be kept separately from private user data, you might have given to us. It will not be given to third parties.
